licensingSteps.title: Complete 75 Hours of Pre-License Education
licensingSteps.desc: Enroll in a GREC-approved 75-hour Salesperson Pre-license course. You must pass the course final exam with a score of 72% or higher.

licensingSteps.title: Obtain a GCIC Criminal History Report
licensingSteps.desc: Visit a local sheriff's office or police station to obtain a Georgia Crime Information Center (GCIC) report. This report is valid for 60 days and must be brought to the exam center.

licensingSteps.title: Pass the Georgia Real Estate Salesperson Exam
licensingSteps.desc: Register with PSI to take the state exam. The exam consists of 152 questions, and you must score 75% or higher on both the National and State portions.

licensingSteps.title: Apply for Your License
licensingSteps.desc: You can apply for your license immediately at the PSI test center after passing. Bring your Lawful Presence Verification and the $170 license fee.

licensingSteps.title: Find a Sponsoring Broker
licensingSteps.desc: To activate your license, you must be sponsored by a Georgia broker. If you don't have a broker yet, you can apply for an inactive license.

eligibility: Must be at least 18 years old
Must have a high school diploma or GED
Must have a US Social Security number
Must provide a GCIC criminal history report (no more than 60 days old)
educationExam: Pass Georgia state exam (152 questions, 75% to pass)

topics: Property ownership and land use controls
Real estate valuation and market analysis
exam.passRate: NEEDS_REVIEW: State average not publicly available
exam.prepTip: The Georgia exam requires passing BOTH the National (100 questions) and State (52 questions) sections with a 75%. Don't neglect the state-specific laws.

faqs.q: How much does it cost to get a real estate license in Georgia?
faqs.a: The total cost is typically between $500 and $800. This includes the 75-hour pre-license course ($180–$450), the $121 state exam fee, the $170 license application fee, and approximately $40 for a background check.

faqs.q: How long does it take to get a real estate license in Georgia?
faqs.a: Most students complete the process in 3 to 8 weeks. The 75-hour course can be finished in under a month if you study full-time, but may take longer if you study part-time.

faqs.q: What are the requirements for a Georgia real estate license?
faqs.a: You must be at least 18 years old, have a high school diploma or GED, complete 75 hours of approved education, pass a background check, and pass the state licensing exam.

faqs.q: Is the Georgia real estate exam hard?
faqs.a: The exam is challenging because you must pass both the National and State sections with a 75% score. Comprehensive exam prep is highly recommended to ensure you pass on the first try.

faqs.q: Can I take the Georgia real estate course online?
faqs.a: Yes, the Georgia Real Estate Commission (GREC) allows you to take the 75-hour pre-license course entirely online. Online courses offer flexibility to study at your own pace.

faqs.q: How much do real estate agents make in Georgia?
faqs.a: The average annual income for a Georgia real estate agent is typically between $60,000 and $85,000. Top producers in busy markets like Atlanta can earn significantly more, often exceeding $110,000.

faqs.q: Do I need a college degree to be a real estate agent in Georgia?
faqs.a: No, you do not need a college degree. The minimum education requirement is a high school diploma or a GED.

faqs.q: What is the best real estate school in Georgia?
faqs.a: The best school depends on your learning style. RealEstateU is a popular choice for its affordable, self-paced online packages that include the required 75-hour course.

faqs.q: How do I choose between online and in-person classes?
faqs.a: Online classes are best for students who need flexibility and a lower cost. In-person classes are better if you prefer a structured classroom environment and direct interaction with an instructor.

faqs.q: Can I get a real estate license in Georgia with a criminal record?
faqs.a: It is possible, but you must disclose your history. You will need to provide a GCIC criminal history report, and the Commission will review your background to determine eligibility.
